intro: Sarcosiphon rodwayi, commonly known as the New Zealand sea holly, is a marine alga found in the coastal waters of New Zealand. It belongs to the order Fucales and is characterized by its branching thallus with a distinctive, spiny appearance. The plant has a filamentous structure with a central axis and lateral branches, and it thrives in rocky intertidal zones. It plays an important ecological role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms. Sarcosiphon rodwayi is also used in traditional Māori practices and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
